ytfetcher.services package¶

Submodules¶

ytfetcher.services.exports module¶

class ytfetcher.services.exports.Exporter(channel_data: list[ChannelData], allowed_metadata_list: Sequence[Literal['title', 'description', 'url', 'duration', 'view_count', 'thumbnails']] = ('title', 'description', 'url'), timing: bool = True, filename: str = 'data', output_dir: str = None)¶

Bases: object

Handles exporting YouTube transcript and metadata to various formats: TXT, JSON, and CSV.

Supports customization of which metadata fields to include and whether to include transcript timing.

Parameters:

  • channel_data (list[ChannelData]) – The transcript and metadata to export.

  • allowed_metadata_list (list) – Metadata fields to include (e.g., [‘title’, ‘description’]).

  • timing (bool) – Whether to include start/duration timing in exports.

  • filename (str) – Output filename without extension.

  • output_dir (str | None) – Directory to export files into. Defaults to current working directory.

Raises:

  • NoDataToExport – If no data is provided.

  • SystemPathCannotFound – If specified path cannot found.

METEDATA_LIST¶

alias of Literal[‘title’, ‘description’, ‘url’, ‘duration’, ‘view_count’, ‘thumbnails’]

export_as_csv() → None¶

Exports the data as a flat CSV file, row-per-transcript-entry.

export_as_json() → None¶

Exports the data as a structured JSON file.

export_as_txt() → None¶

Exports the data as a plain text file, including transcript and metadata.

class ytfetcher.services.Exporter(channel_data: list[ChannelData], allowed_metadata_list: Sequence[Literal['title', 'description', 'url', 'duration', 'view_count', 'thumbnails']] = ('title', 'description', 'url'), timing: bool = True, filename: str = 'data', output_dir: str = None)¶

Bases: object

Handles exporting YouTube transcript and metadata to various formats: TXT, JSON, and CSV.

Supports customization of which metadata fields to include and whether to include transcript timing.

Parameters:

  • channel_data (list[ChannelData]) – The transcript and metadata to export.

  • allowed_metadata_list (list) – Metadata fields to include (e.g., [‘title’, ‘description’]).

  • timing (bool) – Whether to include start/duration timing in exports.

  • filename (str) – Output filename without extension.

  • output_dir (str | None) – Directory to export files into. Defaults to current working directory.

Raises:

  • NoDataToExport – If no data is provided.

  • SystemPathCannotFound – If specified path cannot found.

alias of Literal[‘title’, ‘description’, ‘url’, ‘duration’, ‘view_count’, ‘thumbnails’]

export_as_csv() → None¶

Exports the data as a flat CSV file, row-per-transcript-entry.

export_as_json() → None¶

Exports the data as a structured JSON file.

Exports the data as a plain text file, including transcript and metadata.
